Description: Fragment of a tunic with a main cloth in plain weave linen and the lower part with an applied tapestry clavus or shoulder stripe; a broad seam in the main cloth joins two similar pieces; the tapestry is in red wool ground and black wool outlines, details in undyed linen and yellow, light blue, pink and orange wool, missing in large areas, design of horsemen trampling? lions, border of narrow acanthus scrolls, the border extends beyond rounded bottom of main part of clavus and ends in a circular pendentive; balanced plain weave: warp-undyed linen (S/c.15), weft-undyed linen (S/c.15), simple selvedge on each piece, other edges cut in modern times or ragged, a hem seam joins the two pieces of the main cloth, the tapestry is sewn to the main with hemming, sewing thread undyed linen (S spun Z ply); tapestry on plied warp: warp-undyed linen (S spun Z ply/c.9), weft-undyed linen and yellow, light blue, pink, orange wool (S/yellow is 60), cut edges turned under or ragged on the tapestry; fragment is from the waist area of a tunic, the seam running horizontally, the clavus finishing just below the waist
Curator's comments: Unreg. 93a; Unreg. 93b; previously in grey plan chest in Student's Room;
